title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 15 ยง 91.17 - Enforcement agency procedure for uniform traffic ticket (tsleand d area)
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 15 ยง 91.17 - Enforcement agency procedure for uniform traffic ticket (tsleand d area)

State Regulations
(a) Upon receipt of
a quantity of uniform traffic tickets from the Department of Motor Vehicles, the enforcement agency shall inspect each box of tickets to insure that all
assigned tickets are accounted for. Following this inspection, the agency shall
forward the ticket receipt to its data entry location. A list of missing, mutilated or duplicate tickets must also be submitted to the data entry
location. (b) Each bound book of
uniform traffic tickets shall be assigned by the agency to an individual police
officer. The police officer shall inspect each book and complete the Receipt
for Uniform Traffic Tickets (UT 1.2 or UT 3.2, whichever is appropriate), which
shall be submitted to the appropriate office within the agency. (c) The police agency's traffic ticket
coordinator shall complete a "Report of Lost or Voided Tickets" and submit same
to the appropriate location at such intervals and in such manner as the
commissioner may determine. (d) Upon the issuance of a uniform traffic ticket by a police officer, and the
return of the completed part IV to the enforcement agency (see section
91.18
of this Part), the
enforcement agency shall submit part IV to its data entry location, at such
intervals and in such manner as the commissioner may determine. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 15
ยง
91.17

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
